newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-FORMER NAPOLI KEEPER GIULIANI DIES AT 38.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FORMER NAPOLI KEEPER GIULIANI DIES AT 38.

text.p: Italian Giuliano Giuliani, the goalkeeper for Diego Maradona's Napoli in their glory years, has died, hospital officials said on Friday.

Giuliani, 38, died of a "grave illness" late on Thursday in the infectious diseases ward of the Policlinico Sant'Orsola in the northern city of Bologna, the officials said. They gave no further details.
Giuliani began his career at third division Arezzo in 1976 and also played serie A soccer at Como and Verona before retiring in 1993 after hepling Udinese win promotion to the top flight.
His high point came at Napoli where he won the UEFA Cup in 1989 and the league title in 1990 with Maradona.
"He was simply a great person," Udinese executive Sigfrido Marcatti, himself a former goalkeeper, told reporters.
"He was one of the chief forces behind the rebirth of this club because he taught everyone what it meant to be a professional," Marcatti added.
Udinese and Napoli players will wear a black armbands in memory of Giuliani when they play their respective matches on Sunday.
